trans-unit.source: Defines an attribute that can be used at the call site to specify the URL where the activation will happen.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Activation.UrlAttribute> is passed in the activation attributes array as a parameter to <xref:System.Activator.CreateInstance%2A?displayProperty=fullName> when creating activated objects with the <xref:System.Activator.CreateInstance%2A> method.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/30386922-1e00-4602-9ebf-526b271a8b87).
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Activation.UrlAttribute"></xref> class.
The call site URL.
The callsiteURL parameter is `null`.
The immediate caller does not have infrastructure permission.
Checks whether the specified object refers to the same URL as the current instance.
This method overrides the default <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The object to compare to the current <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Activation.UrlAttribute"></xref>.
`true` if the object is a <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Activation.UrlAttribute"></xref> with the same value; otherwise, `false`.
The immediate caller does not have infrastructure permission.
Returns the hash value for the current <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Activation.UrlAttribute"></xref>.
The hash value for the current <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Activation.UrlAttribute"></xref>.
The immediate caller does not have infrastructure permission.
Forces the creation of the context and the server object inside the context at the specified URL.

<xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Activation.UrlAttribute.GetPropertiesForNewContext%2A> does not contribute any properties to the new context because it is used by the remoting infrastructure to force the creation of the context and the server object inside the context at the specified URL.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Activation.IConstructionCallMessage"></xref> of the server object to create.
The immediate caller does not have infrastructure permission.

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.Context"></xref> meets <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Activation.UrlAttribute"></xref>'s requirements.
The context to check against the current context attribute.
The construction call, the parameters of which need to be checked against the current context.
`true` if the passed-in context is acceptable; otherwise, `false`.
The immediate caller does not have infrastructure permission.
Gets the URL value of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Activation.UrlAttribute"></xref>.
The URL value of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Activation.UrlAttribute"></xref>.
The immediate caller does not have infrastructure permission.
